review: Yum! Chili's is one of my favorite places to eat. I haven't had a bad experience since I started dining here at this location.  The service has always been fantastic. They are attentive to refills and making sure that dining experience is going smoothly. The food doesn't take long to come out to the table and while you are waiting you can choose an delicious appetizer or get yourself a drink.  It's not really an extremely pricey place and the portion sizes are pretty decent! The food is also delicious! Omnomnom. I always get the Chipotle Chicken Crispers, which are on the 2 for 20 menu. So if you are looking for a place to go out that is reasonable for you and a date or a friend, Chili's is one of my recommendations. Just remember, you come here to eat, not watch calories!

Chili's is a chain restaurant, so I understand gourmet food is not to be expected.  That being said, I still have not been totally satisfied with either the food or service. The most recent visit was just my boyfriend and I, and when we sat down, we were offered chips. No problem, except neither one of us knew they were going to cost us over $3. Nowhere on the menu is there a price for chips, and we didn't know until we got our bill. (from a business point of view, our waiter was a good salesperson for slipping the extra few bucks onto our bill) Next, I ordered a burger, which, I guess Chili's is famous for?? I asked for medium, got well done, and they don't season their meat, so there was NO flavor in my burger. It was also greasy. The amount of fries on my plate was laughable (read: very small amount). We also paid $8 for a couple small egg roll things that were so not worth it. We each had iced tea, paid our $2.50 or whatever for each, and not once were we offered a refill. This is not an isolated case of shoddy service and mediocre food. I have been to Chili's several times and hoped that each time we visited, it would get better. So far, they're getting worse. Unfortunately, I have family members who don't have a picky palate, and they always seem to want to go to places like this. Bummer.

Well I usually don't post reviews but felt it was necessary regarding the last trip my girlfriend and I took here. We came there for a few happy hour drinks and a quick dinner. I think it started when our waitress would ask us if we were ready to order and as I was about to ask a question about one of the items on the menu, she was in such a hurry to get to her next table she just cut me off and said, "I'll give you more time."  My girl then ordered a "Skinny" Margarita which she tried and said was gross. I actually didn't believe her because she is very judgemental towards food and mixed drinks so I tried it. It was so sour it was actually beyond drinkable and believe me, I'll drink just about anything with alcohol in it. We told our waitress, she apologized, and said she would have the bartender make us a different margarita because she assumed it was just the style of margarita we didn't like. They made another, and it tasted the same... Absolutely horrible. I don't think I've ever refused a drink let alone twice but it was necessary as I truly think something they put in it had gone bad. I then asked the waitress if she could try a sip of it so I can prove we are not crazy but she wouldn't, neither would the manager. Which just made us seem like really picky drinkers, which we are not. I've had hundreds of Margaritas from different places and something was wrong with those two.  We then noticed that our food was dropped off at the table next to ours and the people started to eat off the plates. Once they realized their mistake they went over and took the food back from those people and I'm quite positive they weren't going to say anything until the manager saw my girlfriends disgusted face and walked over and said, "So you guys probably noticed we served your food to the wrong table." He asked us if we wanted chips while we wait but we had already ordered some (So I figured at least those would be comped)... Nothing was, not even the Margarita It's too bad because I enjoy the beers and chicken strips and the price isn't terrible but service is a big thing for my gf and I and now they will never have the pleasure of our business again.

I used to hate this location because the manager was super creepy. I don't know if it is finally a new manager or what, but I can finally stand to go here without feeling like I need to run out the door because that creepy manager is staring at me again.  Having recently given this place another try, I'm shocked that I like it so much. No sign of the creepy manager, and a significant improvement in the food over the last few years.  They have a really big gluten-free menu (and even a GF beer!). Seriously, that GF menu is what gets the extra star. More places need to consider this as something important.

3 stars for the service.  It was prompt and attentive, people were doing their jobs.  The prices are great too.  I didn't expect that my $25.00 gift card was going to pay for almost all of my dinner and drink as well as my friends and some chips and salsa.  I almost wanted to rate them 2 stars for my meal, but I'm sure they have some good things on the menu. "Meh, I've experienced better" pretty much sums up my food.  I had the jalepeno burger and it was really just not at all exciting.  It lacked adequate sauce or condiment to make up for the large amount of meat, running on the dryer side.  Kinda left me wishing I had gone to Carl's Jr. for a jalepeno burger, or just ordered something else completely.  The fries are good though, I like the seasoning/saltiness.  Side of chips was very huge for two people as well.  I also noted that they have black bean burger patties to sub in for any of the burger items on the menu so that looks like something good to try, I appreciate more vegetarian options.

First let start by saying i have gone to Chili's on and off throughout the years and i have never had a problem until last night., in fact i have really enjoyed the experience. Last night, was a different story. i would like to also say that i was a hostess/waitress for 2 years so i have a lot of patience with restaurants.. but last night was careless, lack quality control and Chilis employees should take more pride in their work.  Last night, my friend and i were hungry so we headed to a place that we usually can count on. First thing, that drew my attention was the original silverware i was given was visibly dirty ( it had green food bits on it). i politely asked for some more silver which was brought to me for about 20mins after i asked. The only reason i got my second pair of silverware was because they brought our appetizer over and i had to re-ask for it. Also i order a strawberry lemonade which was also not brought until our appetizer was came.  While we are waiting, another server almost gave our food the table behind us. We spoke up before they set the down the food. The next thing that wasn't right was.. i ordered a 6oz steak that i asked for Med-Well ( so the meat should of been slightly pink. i cut it and my steak was BLUE, is was RARE.. and the extra 6 shrimp that i ordered ( and paid about ($5-6 extra), 4 of them were the same size ( the size of a half dollar).. the two others: one was the size of a nickel and the other was the tail part of the Shrimp. That just shows poor quality control.  I stopped a server to ask if we could speak to our server, so i could straighten if i misspoke my order or if it wasn't really my fault. Instead of getting our server, she took my steak to have it cooked more. When i our server did come back we explained the shrimp thing and he brought us 2 new shrimp. Meanwhile, my friend had asked for texas toast and i asked for a side a butter. When i got my butter for my broccoli.. it looked like a side of  clear oil. i tested it and it tasted like oil.. not butter.    A manger was coming by to all the tables, so we explained all our concerns, meanwhile,  my friend still hadn't gotten her toast. The manger offered us 6 new shrimp and did admit to noticing that the shrimp was at bit "shrimpy" . i declined the shrimp because the server we had took care of the problem. The manger took the shrimp off the bill. i asked the manger if the butter normally comes like liquid.. she yes and said the butter comes in blocks and they melt it down and they only sides of butter they have that are solid butter is garlic butter.  When my friend finally got her texas toast, she lifted it and the plate it  was on was DIRTY!  She had dried blood  protein from meat on her plate under toast. WE informed the server of the problem and once again the manger came over. She offered us free dessert, it was a cookie in a skillet with ice cream. I asked my friend how her food was.. she said her rice" had now flavor.. no salt or pepper" and the " chicken was rubbery" We didn't eat a lot of the dessert because the cookie was dry and crumbly.  WE did pay and tip ( we tipped because the restaurant did make an effort to make it right  and i wasn't sure who was really to blame for the whole experience. )  Needless to say, we will not be back for awhile.  **** One thing did notice was the Restaurant is being remodeled... visually the restaurant look fine before.. maybe instead of remodeling they invest in better staff that actually care about the food they serve.

Used mobile app to order and pick up. Was easy to use and was ready on time. Keep forgetting their food is better than expected. Last nights ribs were great. I love how they do their corn on cobb... just wish they had coleslaw as an option.
Atmosphere was great. Open space with banks of TV's in the bar area. Music not too loud and able to carry on a conversation with my wife. Lunch was outstanding. Service was also great.

I've always liked this place. The atmosphere has always been chill, the wait for a table has never been very long, the food is good and the prices are reasonable. It's probably one of the best values for a sit down restaurant.
Good food and you can always expect it to be the same!! The samplers was a great dish - burgers are good and so is the tilapia!  Ask and you shall receive!
Their Southern Smoke House Burger is AMAZING...I always get it when Ranch. Would highly recommend this place!

I've been to allot of Chili's restaurants  all over California and I must say this one is less than par for the chain. Our waiter was nice but seemed to be a bit overwhelmed with the limited tables he had. The food was just ok! As always the manager asks how everything was and you don't want to throw the college kids under the bus so you say it was fine with a smile. I expect to get what I get with this chain but this place needs better management to improve this place to at least meet the Chili's standard. This is my third time here in two years and had the same thoughts every time I left.

The manager on tonight is plain careless. My ribs were cold and he literally offered to microwave them 0_o are you kidding? Our food took 30 minutes to get here and then you offer to microwave it to make it warm? The only good thing tonight was our waitress. Oh and bonus the manager on tonight has NO name tag on. I usually love chilis but this experience has left me with a COLD sour taste in my moutn

This was the second time I had been to Chili's. The first time was in Inglewood (yup, getting my grub in the hood) and really, the experience was less then desirable. However, on my second trip to Chili's (this time in Chico) the experience was friggin AWESOME! Our server was Alex and this dude was on point with everrrrrrrrything. There was a slight delay on getting our food because the place was packed but he was extra nice, uber attentive and communicated constantly to keep us in the loop about the food delivery time (I can appreciate that. I hate when waiters leave me hangin wondering where my food is man, that pisses me off!). Alex did none of this, he must have been by the table 10 times, smiling and ready to answer our constant questions about the menu and drinks. After our food was delivered and the drinks were flowin the manager (Deanna) stopped by twice to see that we were enjoying ourselves, the food and the drinks... umm, YEAH, BEST COCKTAIL I've EVER had. Honey child, I don't lie when I say this drink is what I believe they serve in Heaven when you arrive.  Mmm Mmmm.... Blackberry Patron Margarita, served in a patron bottle shaker with fresh blackberries floating around inside the shaker. I know your drooling so go ahead and wipe that slobber off your face homie. Yeah, you know you want one. Better hurry yer butt up because they're doing away with this drink soon. WHY DAMMIT you ask?!?!?!!??! I asked the manager and she said its because they are coming out with another signature drink (in my opinion surely wont even compare to this one). BOO!  The only complaint I have is about the salmon. I didn't think to ask until AFTER I ate it but I was told (by the manger) that the salmon is farmed. DISGUSTING. Have your read about farmed salmon?? Read up on it- its SICK man, just NASTY. Otherwise, I would have given Chilis 5 stars... the service was awesome, the drinks were stellar but the fish, doodoo. I'll be back though, I gotta get the recipe to that drink that will soon be gonezo. Its MINE, all MIIIIIIIIIINE!!

Eww, Chili's is awful. I've given this place maybe 10 trys over the years they've been in Chico and every time I do it is a disappointment. Basically it's to the point where if a friend/date suggests we go to Chili's, I kind of reevaluate my decision to be hanging out with them because obviously they make bad life choices. The service is always terrible, the food is always previously frozen half reheated garbage, the drinks are weak, and the place needs a good cleaning. The chips and salsa taste like salted paper, and the meat is comparable to that of a lunchable. It's a typical chain restaurant that I try to avoid.

The Molten Chocolate Cake is a real dream, best dessert ever!!! I used to go every weekend with the family (now trying new things in Chico). Also little chicken bites for kids are so good my baby loves it :) Also good atmosphere day and night. Really bad customer service!
My first visit here wasn't the greatest. They have remodeled the store a a it looks and feels great. Service was amazing (thanks Dillion) also the price was a deal. Will come back soon

Every time I go here, I have great service and the wait staff is always so attentive! I love going to a place and feeling like the employees love their jobs. The food is decent and a great value, it's one of our regular spots! Try mango chili chicken!
Avoid: ( verb ) keep away from, stay away from, steer clear of, give a wide berth to, fight shy of. ANTONYMS confront.
Average food at average prices. The service is usually top notch, hence why I go. Last time I went, I had endless soup, salad,  and chips and salsa. No complaints. Our waitress was fantastic.

Arrive in Chico to visit for a few hours and the people are very nice.  In about after three hours of touring the city, we got pretty hungry.  We chose Chili's Grill and Bar because we were familiar with the foods.  The hostess that seated us was nice and the waitress was very helpful.  I guess I didnt know that you can now pay at your table with your Debit Credit with a Kiosk machine. I thought that was really cool.  Im not quite sure what my dish was called but I can say I got the Chicken Enchilada with Chicken Tostada. It had also black beans and rice.  Very delicious.  I left pretty happy.
Food was great. Ordered their watermelon margarita, did not have alcohol in it . No bueno. Then hey messed up on our bill. Gave us the wrong one.

-Rude waitress - Honestly like almost every time im here, I leave annoyed from their attitude or lack of personality. They just don't seem helpful or happy (the girls at least). Last time i went  here the girl was trying to take our order so fast she couldn't understand my question about a coupon i had and refused to use it. Then someone at the table asked for his shrimp to be cooked separately and her response was rudely "why is there a reason or something?!" Who cares why, you're not eating it. Then i asked politely to speak to her manager and she was like uhhh why and wouldnt go get her for a few second so we just stared at each other lol.  -She even messed up and put someones order in twice, and forgot to put in his girlfriends order. -The manager i didn't get her name but shes a short thicker lady, VERY NICE! She took care of the situation so great! She was nice, attentive, and listened to what i was saying. Food is great, service sucks. When I go eat out, i don't want to feel like im bothering these people. Tables are your tips!
The food reminds me of a greasy spoon. Their bar is fun, and happy hour is happy. Don't get me wrong the food is good, the good stuff is not healthy.

Our waitress Laurie was so incredibly rude and disrespectful. Everytime we come to chilis we order the two for 20$ and they ALWAYS let us get the queso for the appetizer for an extra 79 cents. Laurie was extremely rude and started flipping through my menu. I then politely asked her to give us a few more minutes due to the fact that our whole plan changed because she refused to honor what we always ordered. We didn't see her again for 25 minutes. She came back and we ordered, then we didn't see her again for another 30 minutes. We didn't get our appetizer until 5 minutes before our main courses arrived and we weren't given any silver wear or napkins. Our burgers came cooked rare when we ordered them well done and our glasses were empty. We asked for the bill and had to wait another 25 minutes for her to come. we love chilis but because of this horrible experience I don't think we will be going back to the Chico location ever again. Congratulations Laurie you just lost two loyal customers due to your rudeness.

Chili's is your classic chain restaurant known for their baby back ribs. I've never tried them because I don't eat ribs in public. :) But I have tried their soups, salads, and the Mexican-Americanized fare. And I have to credit them where credit is due. They are consistent, at least in my experience. The food isn't fantastic but I knew that coming in and I was served a meal that was exactly what I expected from a Chili's restaurant. We chose to go on a Sunday afternoon and since this location resides in a Mall parking lot, they were packed with hungry shoppers like ourselves.  The bar area was crowded with patrons glued to the two major NFL games that were playing. So our poor hostess had to wipe down a table herself just to make room for us. Our server was prompt and kind enough. He was always on top of our drink refills. Something I love when going out to eat. Our food arrived quickly despite the afternoon rush. I had a chicken soft taco with rice and beans. I was surprised at how flavorful the rice and beans both were. The soft taco was okay, but I've had better. My sister seemed to enjoy her bacon burger although she wasn't asked how she wanted it cooked. Her French fries looked fresh also. The price for three people came out to be quite reasonable. I paid easily via the little computers they have perched on each table and off we went. I'd definitely return since it's more satisfying than anything I would find in the Mall's food court.

Drinks came in a timely manner but the food took forever. We were seated and ordered before the table next to us was seated and they got their food before us and half way finished before we got ours. I was about to walk out as my 2 young kids were hungry and waited much longer than they should of. Doesn't take that long to make Kraft Mac and cheese.

Review for BAR ONLY.  I'm here most Sundays for all day happy hour - and football. So are a few other patrons I've started to recognize. The bartender has me figured out by now. I always have a Margarita or two,  $4.50 each. The draft beer is ice cold, and chips and salsa are free!  The food is good. Typical chain restaurant food, but I always like what I get. Friendly servers and customers alike. Colin is the bomb. I'll keep coming back.

Went to Chili's in Chico with my family tonight. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Salad and asked for grilled chicken instead of the fried chicken. I had to take the "grilled" chicken off of my plate because it had a boiled texture, horrible. I then noticed there were no grill marks on the grilled chicken. I asked the manager about it, and told him about the texture of the chicken and he told me it is put through an oven with a conveyor belt. I have a lot of restaurant experience, and I can tell from the boiled consistency and texture that the chicken was put in there oven while the chicken was still frozen. I will say that the staff did offer to replace my chicken or cook it longer, but I was not going to wait for another sub-par piece of chicken because people that should barely be called cooks and the management staff are not smart enough or versed in cooking techniques enough to know how to cook appropriately. HERE IS A FREE COOKING LESSON FOR THE COOK STAFF, MANAGEMENT, AND CHILI'S EXECUTIVES......YOU DON"T COOK CHICKEN UNTIL IT IS THAWED OR IT TASTES BOILED BECAUSE IT ESSENTIALLY HAS BEEN.

I had the best time coming here. I always love chilies and just moved up here so i had to try this place. The food was perfect. Staff and service was attentive and friendly. The definition of a fantastic resturant. You cant go wrong with anything on the menu and the 2 for $20 deal is a perfect lunch date.

horrible! went there and got dirty dishes,plates and rude staff. we had the kids and just thought they might be busy so we gave it another shot. just went there and again RUDE staff. the place was not even busy and it took 15 mins to get drinks. the food was okay but not grand. and we ordered dessert but our person forgot to put it in so they played it off like we didnt order it. took they 20 mins to check on us too. that place is the most unorganized restaurant in chico. i will never go back there!

We live in Redding and went to Chico to take our daughter to pick out her birthday presents at Toys-R-Us.  Decided to go to a chain restaurant we don't have in Redding being Chili's.  It was Valentine's day on a Saturday.  The restaurant didn't seem busy and plenty of parking.  We were told the wait would be 10 minutes.  We were seated and noticed each table has a "tablet" that you can order from and pay your bill.  This thing was disgusting!  It looked like somebody's kid was allowed to play on this thing with greasy hands.  All I could think about was transfer of coodies from patron to patron.  Asked the waitress if we could get it cleaned off and she told us they were really busy and she would when she had a chance.  Gross.  The kids were hungry so we ordered some chips and salsa for $3.95 good thing they were bottomless.  Our order took an hour to get to the table.  The food was meh at best and by the time we left, we spent two hours at the restaurant.  Had a problem with our son's order and the management was on it and removed the item from our bill without asking.  The manager was awesome, very personal and understanding.  Sadly, I would have given this review 1 star if it weren't for her.  And for the tablet cleanliness situation, I gave up, went to the bathroom and got a wet paper towel and cleaned it myself.  We left wishing we could have a lunch do-over.
Great lunch spot! Very friendly staff, I would recommend to anyone looking for a good lunch atmosphere.
Food tasted microwaved and fake. My salad was good but everyone else's meals looked frozen then heated.

Restaurant seemed clean at first but the floor under our table was filthy with scraps of leftover food. Once we ate, I understood why it was under there! Food was mediocre.. Their chips are paper thin & salsa is very tomato-y, but I guess some ppl might like that depending on personal preference. Cheese fries would've been good if they were hot & fresh but they came out with cold, hard cheese.. they had clearly been sitting for a while. Pickle fries were awful, I do not recommend! They tasted EXACTLY like McDonald's pickles with a thin, tasteless, crispy batter. We ordered 1 sprite & 2 skinny patron margaritas- we got 3 sprites & 2 extremely sweet margaritas that you could hardly taste any tequila.. We took a few sips & left them alone. However the southwest egg rolls & their guacamole were both good! Service was pretty slow, waitresses were nice enough. Overall a waste of money, lesson learned! Never going back
Worst burger I've ever had. The food has become mediocre, just like Applebee's. I'd much rather eat at a local restaurant, than a chain like this.

Went to eat here with a friend for lunch. I am what you may call a chilis frequent flier. I come here often because they normally have great service, awesome on refills, and check in with guests frequently.  I can easily say this is the worst chilis experience I have ever had. The food took 40 plus minutes to come to the table, I've never waited this long for food at chilis before. The restaurant was dead, so it's not like they were even busy. The only good thing about the visit was that the waitress tried to atone for the slow service by giving us some chips and salsa while we waited. I had to ask two separate waitresses for a refill who looked visibly annoyed. When the waitress dropped off our food she left without asking us if we needed anything. I was THIS close to walking up to the bar and asking for a refill and a side of ranch. after waiting another 20 minutes with no attention she came up and asked if we needed anything. I told her I had been waiting a while for a refill and she quickly grabbed it but seemed completely unapologetic when I told her I had been waiting for a while. By the time I got my refill and ranch my food was cold. This was the most disappointing restaurant experience I have had in a while. The restaurant was also dirty, with dirty bathrooms and no soap in the soap dispenser. Not sure what is going on with this location but I think they need to reevaluate whoever is managing this location and letting it get this bad. I go to chilis for their quick food and good service. I will not be going back to this Chilis location.

Same consistently cold food and long wait times! Ugggg.  How can Chili's in one town be so good and Chili's in Chico be so bad?   The staff seems super nice however after multiple visits I continue to have the same bad experiences: cold food and long wait times. Today at lunch a girlfriend and I waited 45 minutes for a salad and a chicken sandwich. Really? And the place was definitely not full.  This is the same experience my husband and children and I had about a month ago. I keep trying hoping that they will get their act together but Chili's in Chico is a no go for me :(
Food was fantastic!!! We had the best server EVER!! Bre was awesome, recommended the perfect food, it was fast and hot and drinks were full ALWAYS!! Best experience!!!

Mediocre. As expected. The food is taking over half and hour for one item and it's dead in here!! ): we thought it would be fast but i guess not. I don't think I'll return again when I have plans after

Took one solid hour to get our fajitas.  ONE HOUR!  When I told manager she offered to change mp our chips and salsa and whopping $3 dollar credit on a 50 dollar bill.  I said what is a positive yelp review worth to you.  She said I don't know!   Wow NEVER had bad service at chilis.  Our server was fine but kitchen was one hour behind on signature dish.

Used the mobile up for pick up, it was easy to use. However, the order was not ready on time and the workers seemed to be unorganized about it. We were about 6 people waiting for our pick up orders ..  Also, they were about to make me pay twice till I told them hey I already paid!  Very disappointed, slow service !

Our last visit was what boost my opinion to 4 stars. We sat in the bar area and had a waitress named Cammy or Camie. Can't recall. But she was really great. I typically think their food is just 3 stars but I ordered these yummy little burger sliders. They were exceptional. We also had chips & salsa, and every time they brought out more chips they seemed fresh and were hot. Dang good. I have also gotten their quesadilla explosion salad and flat bread pizzas. All very good. After having 1 bad experience at Applebees across the street, we are now loyal to Chili's. Keep up the good work.
Very different from the last time I was here. Good food but I miss the ooey gooey apples.

I love how every Sunday they have half off appetizers ! Food is pretty good for the most part and some staff are very nice and friendly ! Not full five because I've had terrible customer service but I've also had great amazing service .. But I do love this place !

my family and I went to Chili's for dinner and the service was very slow. It took 2 hours to get our food and when it came, my wife's steak was raw, my "steamed broccoli" wasn't steamed. it wasn't even cooked. the skillet mashed potatoes were cold, and it was obvious that they had been sitting out for a while. I asked the manager for new broccoli and he brought me another plate but those were also undercooked, just slightly warm.  another table was having the same issues and one guy had his food given away. they brought out this other tables food and the waitress said someone had taken his plate. it wasn't even that crowded, I'm not sure what happened tonight. I won't be returning. I was unimpressed.
Raw chicken. I was then charged twice! No discount, nothing!!! Worst experience I ever had at a chili's!

This places has one of the worst customer services ever. To start off we waited 7 min in the front since there was no hostess in the front to help us. A line had formed and there was about 4 groups behind us waiting as well. When we finally got our seat we ordered our food and it took us about 40 min before our food came out. We ordered an appetizer and before it came it we told our waitress that we no longer want the appetizer since how long we have been waiting. Within 5 min they brought out the appetizer and then later charged us for it. When we were all done eating (after waiting so long for our food) we asked the manager for a to go box (at that time we were already irritated from the bad service and wait time for our food) we sat there for another 7 min before we realized she forgot about our to go boxes so we asked our waitress instead. We waited about another 5 min while we watched our waitress standing around and talking to a waiter. At that point my boyfriend got up and went up to her and asked her for a to go box. She rolled her eyes and she turned around and walked away. My boyfriend was shocked at how rude she was and unprofessional she was. The guy waiter she was talking to went and got my boyfriend a to go box. I wish I would have gotten the name of the waitress but she is the little lady with the really bad acne scars and acne with a face full of makeup.

This was  a horrible experience... Called for pickup with what was told a 15 minute wait... Which I gave them time and waited 20 minutes  (aftrr driving over) at the bar "for my onion rings". Ordered jakepenos for the top of our (2 for $20 burgers) never got them. Ordered a side salad (for my side) never got it. Only 1 burger came with condiments (onion, tomatoes, etc.) Therefore burger was dry (bun, cheese, and bacon), neither were near medium. Rest of the food was cold, as we waited in the onion rings.  Do yourself a favor and go to Applebee's, both are same quality but better food. Props to the bartender as he handled that entire side of the building, while everyone else talked in the corner by the bar. And watched my food get cold and  incomplete.
Food is always really good here. Despite it being a chain I feel like the taste and quality doesn't suffer. Also has nice service.

I seriously love this place. I've had a couple ups & downs, but overall the food has never disappointed me. If you're looking for a good margarita try the "El Niño". Just make sure you have someone to drive for you. For about $8 bucks it gets you pretty toasted lol & it's also sooooooo good!

Came here tonight on a date night with the boyfriend, and we are so glad we did! Great food and amazing service! Our server Eli was just wonderful!!! She was attentive, very nice, and fun to talk to when she'd stop by the table to check on us. We'll definitely be back for another date night soon.

Slow service. Non responsive servers unless you stand up and jump out at one. Food is good always but plan on waiting for 30 mins during regular service, dinner or lunch. Best to go into the bar and order there. Service is a bit faster.

I've eaten at far better Chili's locations. The worst was that there was garbage left from 3 different previous parties/guests (in front of us, to the side, and in the corner, then near the bar on the way out for the duration of the time I was there and no employees in sight. It was gross! The food was okay, but the garbage will keep me from going back.

Had lunch here the other day. Not many customers and now I know why. We waited about 40 minutes for a very simple and disappointing meal. The one positive - the employees are friendly and our waitress was on top of refilling our drinks.

So  despite all the bad things people have had to say about Chili's in the last couple of years I decided to give it one more shot because I have been a fan of their beer battered chicken tenders one of the classics on the menu.. but at the end of the day I was  wrong the chicken tenders were absolutely horrible I thought to myself how can you mess up  "chicken tenders"?...well i guess chilis knows best ... at best the chicken tenders were elastic the corn of course is GMO and mashed potatoes at least are edible do yourself a favor and take Chili's off your list if you haven't already I regret going and giving it a second chance.
Food quality is consistent. We know what to expect. We hope to get Jesse as our server -- good server, great personality.

Food was okay, waitress was unattentive and left our used empty plates on the table as she walked by 5 times and saw them but never grabbed them, even though we even stacked them for her to make it easy.

Food was  consistent with prior visits and worth the money. However, the service, especially with the staff in the bar area, is HORRIBLE.  They are rude and inattentive. Talking to the manager is worthless too. She doesn't seem to think there is a problem, maybe because she is too busy shooting the s$$t with her friends. Very disappointing visit.

Chilis is our go to place for happy hour! usually sit at the bar area. Been going for years! We love Bri!  Tonight however we had a different server. was very disappointing. Our service was horrible!!! Waitress just dropped our food off and walked away without asking (or giving us a chance to ask) if we needed anything.  She never returned to check on us or offer refills, never got the water i asked for. We were looking at the dessert menu on the kiosk thing and she walked by our table and left the check. Overall it was just a bad experience!

We have been waiting for over half an hour for a simple dinner. Service is terrible. One lady at a nearby table took our her Knitting she had been waiting so long. The table next to us had to get their food boxes to go because it took so long.  Totally unacceptable for a chain restaurant. Very poor management. Will never return.

I must start out saying it was Awesome! My server was Ryan and Miranda!  They rock! Super attentive they both have great personalities. Our food was amazing and so yummy.  We started with chips, guacamole and watermelon margaritas. Our dinner was chicken fajitas, ribs with fries and Margarita chicken over black beans with rice. I have to say the chicken was so moist and tender. The flavor was to die for. It was so much food between the 3 people was had two huge take home boxes of food!!!!!  Everything was amazing!!!! Yum
Food was ok Service was very good atmosphere is loud  Only good thing we had is the lava cake and the service was amazing just the food salty cheap good chips and salsa

After coming here for the last 10 years I've witnessed this Chilis and it's employees go down hill! My food here tonight was nasty! How do you mess up the chicken crispers that used to be so good?  The waitress Bree was SO rude! You can tell she hates it there! No refills, food took forever, wouldn't honor our coupon and seemed like she got some enjoyment from saying no.  Seems she's taking it out on people, was very condescending and pretty much ignored us the whole time. The food took a really long time and was disgusting and chicken was dry and inedible! Bummer Chilis sucks so bad now! Waitress Laurie is also extremely rude and said inappropriate things.. takes a really long time and never remembers to bring anything you ask for.

Ugh - sitting here waiting for our bill while the bartender/waiter is chatting up what appears to be an employee off duty having too many drinks. Food was cold, super slow service and the ziosk isn't working so we can't even pay the bill at the table and leave.  Very disappointing :(

Wow, you can never go wrong at Chili's. I always come to the Chico Chili's. I drive 35 mins to come here! The service is always excellent! The food is great. They are always improving with new menu items. I would highly recommend this place! My new favorite is the Caribbean salad! It's seriously the best!! My other favorite is the honey chipotle chicken crispers. Thank you Chico Chili's! My always go to place. Thank you to all the servers who are ALWAYS so friendly!!

No wi-fi available to customers although you know they have it since they offer a trivia game device. Really bad form Chili's! Terrible pour on my first glass of wine but much better on second. Bartender is best thing about this experience. Ordered fried pickles for appetizer which is probably one of the grossest things I've ever seen. See attached photo. Bartender asked how they were and I simply pointed to them. Even though he'd never had fried pickles he could tell they had little or no batter on them. Basically I was served hot pickles! I'm only giving two stars because the bartender was great. All except for calling me ma'am! LOL! Shame on the Chico Chili!'s! One of my fave places in SoCal but this one sucks. My second and last time here. Don't bother peeps.

The food was ok but the service was awful tonight. Our server could care less if We received out dinner or drink refills.  The restaurant was not busy, but out service was awful.  Jesse our server got a very small tip based in his service. No manager was available to discuss.  I would not recommend eating here.  Poor service all around.

Our first time here- we won't be back!! The manager is awesome - she was very attentive- the rest of the staff need replaced! My table was dirty, both of our knives were dirty. I asked about gluten & spy allergies- the waitress handed me a computer to scroll thru- I had a turkey burger wrapped - the lettuce was old and wilted, displayed on a tray with a paper. The meat was so tough and bland, I cut the paper:( my friend had ribs- small portion, plain, not full of flavor- both meals were cold. We yelled out the the waiter who dropped off our food for some ranch and ketchup- he slid ita crossed the table and left quickly.  Nobody asked if our meal was okay- we paid using the computer device and left- lunch took 1 1/2 for fake cold food, non responsive waitress, rude waiter and dirty utensils and table. WE WONT BE BACK

Ssa at the bar and had dinner. Descent service by hard working bartender. Other than the feel that this restaurant is a chain it wasn't terrible. Guacamole burger with fries $10. I paid an extra $1 to get grain feed beef patty instead of cheaper meat which to me is a nice option that Chili offers. The meat was a little too dry which I'm not was due to over cooking or possibly to low fat content. Not a large burger as well as not too bad. Not great either and I won't be ordering it again as it left me feeling that it was mediocre. Food came on a rectangular metal plate with paper placed over the metal.  They had maybe about 8 beers on tap. If you're into wines this is not the place for you as not only their selection is very limited but also they only had one red wine glass and the rest were basic non stemmed glasses.

Always great atmosphere and food. Enjoy dining here. Ribs are always a great choice. Blackberry tea is yummy!! Love molten lava cake. Love curbside option and being able to save a table or to order online or on an app to save time.
service is horrible, waitresses have an attitude every time I go. because of this I won't be attending to this specific location anymore.

I went here expecting to get my usual order (Wings no sauce with drumsticks only) but when I ordered it this time my waiter straight out said "no!" And I was kinda shocked by that answer because I order wings with the drumsticks only all the time so I asked her if they can check if they can make it she then proceeds to go in the back and bring out the manager and the manager then acts like I'm a idiot or something saying they can't do drumsticks only and they've never done that before so I told her I was here 2 nights ago and got the same order no problem she then tells me she was here two nights ago and nobody ordered that the managers attitude was so rude and I don't think it's right to call a customer a liar why would I lie about getting drumsticks only I order it all the time but after this instance I will not return and I suggest you don't either if I could give zero stars I would if you like being belittled when trying to order your food then this is the place to go
A family weekend tradition! After every soccer game my sons favorite place to celebrate a win is Chili's!

Excellent service tonight.  Our server Whitney was amazing. She was wonderful with our children; keeping them entertained all night so my wife and I could enjoy our meals. She even gave them some Swedish fish candy when they started crying and they loved it. Our drinks came out before she even left the table. We love the atmosphere of this chili's! We will be be back again for Monday night football! Go cowboys!

Service was great! The Fajitas were very good. I like the boneless chicken wings appetizer. Our waitress kept coming around making sure we had enough drinks, see if we needed anything, etc. I was a bit disappointed when she told me her schedule is based on the reviews from her customers.  Awesome job Jessica!!!!

Nobody goes to Chili's expecting Gordon Ramsey dining.  With that said everything you order is bathed in a salt bath.   Might as well as just put salt licks on the table and get it over.  My burger was burned, then rest of the food was ok, but sodium was through the roof.   Sorry Chili's lay off the damn salt.

Had lunch here yesterday with my wife, the first booth in the bar that we sat at smelled like urine! So we moved, the tables and menus felt as if they had not been cleaned for over a week! Floors and windows dirty! Bar tender was doing everything! So the service was not very good! Food was so bad we didn't finish it and left the rest! Mixed drinks pretty good but was not offered water till we where getting up to leave! The manager was there but wasn't doing anything but standing in the way to the restroom! White sauce on chicken enchiladas tasted like ranch! YUCK! Wont be going back to a Chilis ever!

I usually get to go food from them but I decided to dine in with some friends and the burger was over cooked and the bun was old and the grilled cheese sandwich was cold and the cheese was cold and solid when I came to the table and the garlic bread I got was burnt on one side so the cook flipped it to the side that wasn't burnt and gave it to me. The waiter made our experience very uncomfortable every time I went to ask him something when he came out he would keep his head straight so I had to raise my hand and wave tiger his attention but I have the feeling he was ignoring me. He was about in his late forties I don't know if that is why he had a poor attitude but he was being very inattentive. I wanted and appetizer after I order and he was a hassle to get him back to my table again and when he brought it out he slide it in the table around a drink really fast and kept walking. I won't be back there.
